result.title: First week.
result.content:
Hello everyone, I want to start off by saying that I understand some of these concepts are completely new to some of you, you just need to read about what you didn't understand or ask me either here or on my fb account or my email haneen.saleh95@gmail.com

COMPLEXITY

The first thing we did was talk about the complexity of an algorithm, and that to avoid getting a Time Limit Exceeded verdict-like the verdict we got by submitting the first solution to the interesting drinks problem, we didn't have enough time to apply binary search to that problem- if the time limit is two seconds than the complexity of your solution should be less than 10^7, and if it was one second then it should be less than 10^6. In the link below I will put any external resources, I added a slide show about complexity. https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Cw_AKzcjgSStCbCBtMy8OHMJRykmj74p

BINARY SEARCH

Binary search is the process of eliminating half of a range because that range has numbers outside of our interest.

Here is little demonstration. https://www.cs.usfca.edu/~galles/visualization/Search.html

The complexity of finding a number in a range is log (n). This is very fast, in comparison with the naive O(n) solution. Here is an explained code: https://ideone.com/M7GX8c please solve this problem to fully understand binary search http://www.spoj.com/problems/BSEARCH1/

We also explained binary search the answer, where instead of searching for the number, you search for the answer to the problem. we solved problem !Hasan http://codeforces.com/gym/101257/problem/D

Please note that the questions for this week will not be on binary search instead I will put easy implemintation problems so you would get used to the format and everything

Best of luck!
